statement.p: Guido is flying west at 10500 MSL using the local altimeter setting of 28.50 inHg. In the lower atmosphere the pressure drops approximately 1 inHg per 1000 feet of elevation gained.
How much does the pressure drop from the ground (0 MSL) to 10500 ft above? inHg
If the pressure is 28.50 inHg at 0 MSL, what is the pressure at 10500 ft MSL? inHg

solution.p: Because this is a drop in pressure, the expected pressure is \displaystyle{P}={28.50}\ \text{ inHg}-{10.5}\ \text{ inHg}={18}\ \text{ inHg}.
